title: Manchester United make offer to Emiliano Martinez as Aston Villa exit looks certain - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:

Martinez has twice won the Best Fifa Menâ€™s Goalkeeper award and looks certain to leave Villa Park at the end of the month. Despite having a contract that runs to 2029, the Villans are widely tipped to be cashing in, hoping to replace the Argentinian with a younger keeper.

Ironically, one of the names tipped to replace Martinez at Villa Park is Espanyolâ€™s Joan Garcia, who has also been heavily linked with an Old Trafford switch.
Martinez has also been reported to want Champions League football, which would rule out Saudi but could put United in the picture if they were to win the Europa League final on Wednesday.
If indeed United were to land the South American, it would call into question whether Onana would then be sold or whether they would be left to battle it out for the number one jersey.
Serendipitously, United are set to face Martinez and Villa in their final Premier League match of the season next Sunday.
